result.execSummary:
Karlee Plegge was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Karlee Plegge was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Karlee Plegge

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 04:05 pm - Defendant Karlee Plegge in court with attorney Corey Mehlos, appearing telephonically with leave of the court.  Defendant Karlee Plegge in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files Governor's Warrant.  Mehlos in receive of Governor's Warrant from IL and WI.  Mehlos states defendant wants to challenge the warrant.  Defendant questions time limits as to how long IL has to come and get her.  Court provided Plegge with Governor's Warrant prior to going on the record.  Plegge signs Waiver of Extradition in presence of Court with an X.  Plegge states the X is her signature.  Court signs extradition paperwork.  Court has reviewed reports and warrant and the booking picture appears to be the person sitting in court.  Court accepts the waiver.
Okay'd Attorney Mehlos appearing by phone for hearing 7/13.
Defendant may not leave State of Wisconsin unless turning self into Madison County, IL

03:02 pm - Defendant Karlee Plegge in court, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions defendant concerning if currently on probation.  Schiek states contacted Lincoln County and Madison County IL.  Madison County states Lincoln county should not have released - Governor's Warrant sent May 26th.  Court inquires as to Interstate Compact concerning transfer of probation from IL to WI.  Defendant states did not sign such paperwork.  Court swears in defendant/Court questions defendant/Court provides defendant with Exhibit 1 (Interstate Compact Application) - Provided to defendant for review - Marked.  Defendant states did not sign Interstate Compact Application.  Defendant states last conviction was in 2009.  Defendant has requested counsel.  Schiek/Defendant to bond.  Schiek states warrant requests no bond.  Court sets cash bond.  Hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

01:21 pm - Defendant Karlee Plegge in court, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files Fugitive Complaint.  Defendant/Schiek statement to Fugitive Complaint.  Defendant states had previously been placed in custody in Lincoln County based upon warrant from IL.  Court advises right to attorney.  Mehlos represented in Lincoln County.  Court adjourns to allow Schiek time to contact Lincoln County/Mehols, etc. Court adjourns 01:33 p.m.
